remarks: If two structures have the same group components (properties), they have the same set of subrings.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Feb-2015.)
statement:
subrgpropd.1 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
subrgpropd.2 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
subrgpropd.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
subrgpropd.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .r ` K ) y ) = ( x ( .r ` L ) y ) ) $.
subrgpropd $p |- ( ph -> ( SubRing ` K ) = ( SubRing ` L ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d ph x y $.
